comment: Nice and simple to plot the route, clear and easy to read on my phone. Very quick and helpful technical support.

author: Paul Klein
comment: Very good

author: Paul Smithson
comment: Superb. Worked out some great routes for me that were safe and pleasant. The map graphics are superb. I'm slightly puzzled as to how some people say they prefer Google maps as for me they're like light and dark. For cycling this is way better. I just wish it had the ability to finish route with walking so I could, if necessary, lock up my bike and finish the journey on foot. Other than that it is perfect.

author: tom liber
comment: Just ok. Ridiculous sign up procedure. Took 10 minutes. But very good navigation

reply.author: beemo
reply.content: Dear Tom, thanks for your feedback! We're currently re-developing the whole registration process, so it will be much better very soon :-). Have a good trip! Anna

author: paul mc laughlin
comment: Really terrible navigation compared to Google maps. I bought the road bike and turn by turn navigation because Google maps doesn't really do cycling routes in Italy. From Sorrento to Vesuvius it took me the most horrible possible route - for over a mile it wasn't even a road, I had to get off and carry my bike down loads of steps - and even on roads it would constantly tell me to make a turn but then say "you have left the route " when I took the correct turn. It meant that I had to constantly stop to double check the route on my phone, as I couldn't trust the instructions. Also a lot sorer on battery than it probably should be, meaning that I ran out of battery midway through a journey that I hadn't expected to.

reply.author: beemo
reply.content: Dear Paul, thanks for your feedback. Would you mind sending us a link to the route you refer to, indicating where exactly the quality was not okay? We will then do our best to fix this. For long trips we recommend to take a small power bank. Please try out our latest version for improved navigation instructions. Have a good trrip, Anna

author: Alex Bee
comment: There is no support in app nor on website. I bought turn by turn voice navigation and it stopped working after 3 months

reply.author: beemo
reply.content: Dear Alex, Please send an email to help@naviki.org - we want to understand and fix your voice navigation issue. Sorry for the late reply. Anyway, have a good trip! Anna

author: Max Sch
comment: The free version is doing what I expect to do. Finds good routes and has really detailed map material😊

author: Yuliy Serikov
comment: So far, so good.
No graba las rutas bien, solo tiene n cuenta los primeros 30 segundos, sin duda la versión de Windows phone es mejor.

reply.author: beemo
reply.content: Hello, would you mind sending a short email to help@naviki.org – we would like to provide support but we don't understand your problem yet. Thanks, Anna

author: Luis Eduardo Velez Montoya
comment: Awesome content, but the color palette of the maps is not very easy to read.

author: adam hull
comment: Excellent

author: Fiachra Duffy
comment: Used for European Cycling Challenge so used it for a full month, very out-dated and clunky to use. The main thing you need to do with a recorded trip is to save or pause but the menu is behind a small, unclear button. Will be uninstalling and using Strava once Challenge is over

reply.author: beemo
reply.content: Dear Fiachra, thanks for your feedback – we take that seriously and will implement some improvements soon. Anyway, please keep in mind some major advantages of Naviki like the bicycle specific route planning. Thanks, Anna

author: Michael Nimmo
comment: Poor imitation of other apps with less features and more bugs. Usage for Euro Cycling Challenge has been a disaster. EDIT - even worse at the end of the challenge, unknown to me I had been logged out of Naviki for days....

reply.author: beemo
reply.content:
Hi Michael, we had a temporary server issue (...). But this is fixed and Naviki works stable and a lot faster now. Would you mind trying again with the latest Android update? We will provide some amends if you contact us via ecc@naviki.org – thanks! Tim
As to your EDIT: Sorry, but we can't reproduce that. You can log in again at any time.

comment: Super App. Einfach zu bedienen, tolle Karten, zuverlässige Navigation

author: John Williams
comment: Update: I've given this app a second and third go. Plenty of updates but still terrible. I hope ECC chose better app next year.   (Original feedback)Downloaded to use for group comp, only recorded half of ride and then crashed. Map My Ride much better and I'll continue using that instead

reply.author: beemo
reply.content: Hi John, we had a temporary server issue during the start of the ECC 2017. But this is fixed and Naviki works stable and a lot faster now. Would you mind trying again with the latest Android update? We will provide some amends if you contact us via ecc@naviki.org – thanks! Tim

author: Oscar Lemmer
comment: Gets better and better. I use it primarily for planning spontaneous round-trips with my racing bike. Suggestions are mostly very good. Turn-by-turn voice navigation works like a charm (at the beginning it was horrible, but after several updates it got really sophisticated), you don't need to look at the screen. Routes are also automatically recalculated if you take the wrong street. One suggestion for following update would be that you can change the language of the voice navigation (currently it uses system language oer default).

author: Donatas Laurinaitis
comment: Inaccurate and unreliable. I've been loosing few kilometres almost every time or sometimes even whole track. My gadget has GPS and Glonass and it has never happened when using sports tracker or locus map.

author: peter vickerman
comment: This application is not as good as Strava. There is no button for stop recording. There is no button for finish ride, you have to press back button on your mobile. The save feature is unreliable where I had server errors on 2 rides. You cant use UK post codes as start and finish points on the route planner.

author: Sancho
comment: Ok, maybe this app isn't the best bike tracker out there, but at least it gets updated frequently (thanks for google login fix)

reply.author: beemo
reply.content: Dear Sancho, regrettably Google recently changed their policy for authorization requests within apps, which made necessary a minor adaption of the app. With the current Naviki version this is already fixed. Sorry for the inconvenience. Anna

author: Terry Blount
comment: Not sure if it's working every time. Sometimes shows only part of my bike ride.

author: Kuba Sawosz
comment: Wanted to record some rides all was fine until one day I've noticed that my list of rides looked pretty small. Seems that after an update lost the data.

author: Valerie Stundon
comment: Wen the login screen comes up it is blank no where to input my login details

reply.author: beemo
reply.content: Dear Valerie, please simply use the same user name and password for login at www.naviki.org as you do via your Naviki app. You will then immediately see your routes on our website as well. Please click on your user name to right after you're logged in to see the menu point 'My routes'. Enjoy! Anna

author: Andrew Scott
comment: Despite statements to the contrary, routes still aren't being saved to cloud. Routes still showing phone icon. App just updated a couple of days ago too.

author: Jacob Lovatt
comment: Find it hard to use. Not sure of its working.

reply.author: beemo
reply.content: Hi Jacob, would you mind sending a short email to ecc@naviki.org ? We would like to provide support but we don't understand your problem yet. Thanks, Anna

author: stephen byrne
comment: Discard button too close to save button.

author: Graham Phelan
comment: Unreliable and inaccurate.

author: John Warren
comment: Would be nice if default save was private not public.

author: Jure Podrug
comment: Alles gut

author: Maggie O'Donnell
comment: Rubbish,  the automatic routing presents the wrong route - why would anyone take the route it suggests.  When saving a trip I get a Java error. Error .java.error. socket.  How on earth did this APP get selected for European Cycling Challenge? Last year App and Web interface was much better by miles.

reply.author: beemo
reply.content: Hi Maggie, we had a temporary server issue during the start of the ECC 2017. But this is fixed and Naviki works stable and fast now. Would you mind trying again with the latest Android update? We will provide some amends if you contact us via ecc@naviki.org – thanks! Tim

author: Grazyna Buczkowska
comment: This app drains the battery extremly quickly. It would not last for the dyration of my commute. I had problems registering my username, the error messages were very unhelpful. I had also problems with logging in. Interface is rather poor: how does one stop recording the ride? How one can upload rides from another app for the European cycle challenge. This app put me off partaking in the challenge in the end. I wonder how much money EU has wasted on it?

reply.author: beemo
reply.content: Hi Grazyna, please check our ECC tutorial (https://www.naviki.org/en/naviki/single-pages/ecc-tutorial/) for comprehensive information regarding the usage of Naviki for the ECC. It's actually really easy. Bicycle friendly regards, Anna

author: Tiago Abrantes
comment: It is impossible to import routes over android app. The Web page has some wrong translations and some translated links redirect to localhost server. The app should be able to sync activities with most used apps like Endomondo or Strava.

reply.author: beemo
reply.content: Hi Tiago, you can easily upload routes at www.naviki.org – when you're logged in with the same Naviki account they will appear on the app under 'My routes' as well. The web server issue is fixed and Naviki works smoothly now. Anna

author: Žilvaras Grybauskas
comment: Endomondo is much better. This has many issues of which you can read below and below and below... the good thing is that you can import gpx from endomondo and use for ecc 2017. 3.58.4 fix is still not effective.

reply.author: beemo
reply.content: Hi Žilvaras, we had a temporary server issue during the start of the ECC 2017. But this is fixed and Naviki works stable and a lot faster now. Would you mind trying again with the latest Android update? We will provide some amends if you contact us via ecc@naviki.org – thanks! Tim

author: Silver Rain
comment: If not ECC2017 I would trash this app instantly. On the first trip the route was not recorded: 0km, 0kmph. Reasons unknown. On the second it shows that during my ride I've challenged the elevation of almost 200m and reached the top speed of 57km/h - both measures are totally not true. UX is horrible, user has no confirmation of any action. List of trips is super unfriendly. I can't find option to delete the recorded trip of 0km. Finding ECC2017 contest through the menu is a complete missunderstanding. Rankings have no charts and they are very pure. Navigation is very bad - suggesting me to jump off in the middle of a bridge, etc. I only wonder how this horrible app made to be the official one for ECC2017 ...

author: Plunkett Clarke
comment: Excellent app! Works perfectly for the ECC challenge. Cannot understand all the moaning

author: Péter Felber
comment: Installed because of ECC 2017. Not bad, but I only use it for tracking, where it lacks a few features for me: cannot set default ride type and privacy, no auto pause feature.

author: Ömer Haydar
comment: The worst program i have never ever seen like it ..... toooooo baaad

reply.author: beemo
reply.content: Hi Ömer, would you mind sending a short email to ecc@naviki.org? We would like to provide support but we don't understand your problem. Thanks, Anna

author: Grzegorz Górecki
comment: Can't login through Google oauth because you don't know they blocked your method. Good job

author: Mátyás Fodor
comment: Serving ads and adding premium features looks a bit greedy

author: Rares Chirila
comment: The app needs optimisation. The routes i'm doing are not saving, and it doesn't have a way to work in background. Also it drains the battery. Good luck.

author: Euan Matthews
comment: The app has an error when saving routes
